citation.article-title: Bacillus pulvifaciens sp. nov., nom. rev.

p.s: Description of Bacillus pulvifaciens sp. nov.
Bacillus pulvifaciens (pul.vi.fadens. L.n. pulvis powder, dust; L. pres. part. faciens making; M.L. adj. pulvifaciens making powder or dust)
Rods, 0.5 to 1.0 by 2.0 to 4.0 μm.
Gram positive.
Motile.
Ellipsoidal spores produced in swelling sporangia.
Agar colonies are nonpigtnented, opaque, thin, smooth, circular, and entire and average about 1.0 mm in diameter.
Very weak catalase activity produced by cultures grown on TGY agar.
Oxidase not produced.
Facultatively anaerobic.
Acetylmethylcarbinol, indole, and H2S are not produced.
The pH in Voges-Proskauer (test for acetylmethylcarbinol production) broth is 5.0.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Starch, urea, and egg yolk lecithin are not hydrolyzed.
Casein is hydrolyzed.
Arginine dihydrolase is produced.
Lysine, ornithine, and tyrosine are not degraded.
Citrate and propionate are not utilized; acetate, fumarate, malate, and succinate are utilized.
No growth at pH 5.6 or 5.7.
No change effected in litmus milk in 7 days.
Grows in the presence of 3% NaCl but not 5% NaCl.
Growth not inhibited by 0.001% lysozyme.
Optimum growth temperature, 28°C; maximum temperature, 45°C; minimum temperature, 20°C.
Acid but no gas is produced from D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, maltose, D-mannitol, D-mannose, D-ribose, and trehalose.
DNA buoyant density, 1.703 g/cm3; G+C content, 44 mol%.
Habitat: powdery remnants of dead honeybee larvae (7).
